NAEB E0 Do COMMITTEE
PROM:
Prank E* Schooley
RE:
Harry J. Skornia
In reply to the cable sent from here in September, I have received
a personal letter from Harry. The cable was delayed in the embassy,
apparently because Skornia name had been dropped somewhere in
transmission. So, he received it late. Knowing nothing about the
situation, he wrote on a personal basis, and said I might use pertinent
dope, but asked me not to circulate the letter as such. Here goes....
He is still chairman of the Radio-TV department at Indiana UniversltyÂ«..*
data regarding him are on file with the Bureau of Placement, University
of Michigan....Walter Roberts in charge of Austrian Public Affairs,
New State Building, Department of State, Washington, can provide a
statement on Skornia work in Austria... .The President, Dean and others
at I. U. still insist that they expect Harry baok at Indiana..There
is a possibility that he might elect to go back to I.U. ...There is a
possibility he might elect to stay in present or similar work with
State Department....Any decision probably could not be made until
November, if a decision were required of him....and he probably would be
available no earlier than May 15. He expressed his most sincere
appreciation in being thought of.
With delay in Washington meeting, I shall delay further investigation
on Skornia until I have further word from Ausmus, who is writing.
Skornia address Is: H. J# Skornia
Radio Officer
American Embassy
APO 777, c/o PM,
New York, N. Y.
I have no additional word on Wyim at this hour.
